text:
[trapit-site-2014/] 13 new commits:
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/28c2a1c2a7e3ebe91684ac2ed21c508a3fcd63cf|28c2a1c2a7e3>: Added and styled sign up modal state field.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/938056d51b46057d954f1fcc69ecfecbf704ccf0|938056d51b46>: Wired up leadership social media links.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/5b8a1ccb98c9c220604cc310c2ecea9d9491d7dd|5b8a1ccb98c9>: Vertical space adjustments to the homepage mobile layout.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/8a6b41718346c4bbbdec38152c6d5c0de5cc93e4|8a6b41718346>: Updated overview pdf.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/83eb6a3c5d02b8854164c3bcbfba0311f45bd9f7|83eb6a3c5d02>: Fixed tiles corners on IE.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/dbdc323d83c2302f8026c43303152b37c21d63f6|dbdc323d83c2>: Fixed home logo aspect ratio.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/a413a8730a2480358e07bc604db20ae475ddf0e5|a413a8730a24>: Fixed line-height on last instagram block text.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/298bbcc7db39ad3b3291d143b8256bdbf2b4e408|298bbcc7db39>: Talk bubble size on IE.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/d7c2f1a3ae8e55b6921394bb6a25b4049766888b|d7c2f1a3ae8e>: Fixed IE8 WPAS slider not displaying.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/6708e16df5e01fb1f6313794899c707832ffa90c|6708e16df5e0>: Making sure overflow-x is hidden.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/5cd9ebf3b495d9c72e77a37d0544241ca54fc70f|5cd9ebf3b495>: Redirecting 404 errors to 404 page.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/d4bc9e99b4a0c52059ea56edde18679f90f26e6c|d4bc9e99b4a0>: 404 styles.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/de1733290babe0f414250d8082a5db7ea224c9ae|de1733290bab>: Changed proxy name.
 - gastonfig
Was wondering if it would make sense to have standup some time today to prep for launch.
yes
yes
10am!
Awesome.
wait!
no!
now!?
I'm available
how’re things?
just doing a pre-lunch check in
on pre-launch
good- sent a ZIP file over to kelly a bit ago
awesome/thank you
just checked IE
i’ve been testing in here too
gonna go through everything on my phone next... unfortunately i dont have my ipad on me but will borrow one
ok
i think i have one in center drawer of my desk
you’re welcome to
k thanks

[trapit-site-2014/] 2 new commits:
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/c25b1ad75c50caf862c88c7ffa890b069dd5c303|c25b1ad75c50>: 404 for job-detail pages.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/d70524d2ed4e0ceee5a7b0b51d6b84312924943b|d70524d2ed4e>: Added and styled new field to the inline demo form.
 - gastonfig
Just got off the phone with Pat for another project, and she was sure to stress how happy she is with each member of the uncorked team working on this and mentioned all names. Go team!
nice!
:thumbsup::thumbsup::thumbsup:
sorry - just reading these things. Great to hear
how are things going <@U02618EV1> and <@U0289USNA> ?
<http://i.crn.com/executives/HumePat185.jpg>
Moving along. We may need to push a couple of tasks to post launch, though.
ok
and <@U02618EV1> - do you have a sense of which tasks in particular?

If possible:
1. <https://trello.com/c/DfjC5g81/142-update-arrows-on-featured-testimonials-to-the-ones-you-showed-me>
2. <https://trello.com/c/pLKpNlm4/169-resources-page>
#2 is fine to push to post launch
#1 is something theyve brought up a number of times
i sense that it's probably ok to wait a day or two on... although i think they want it sooner rather than later...
neither are mission critical
Thanks. They're easy but time-consuming tasks.

I am still working on transitioning assets from our s3 bucket to theirs.   I didn't have the correct access credentials needed for migrating, but David Mercer just emailed me letting me know he fixed that so I'll give it another go.
<@U02618EV1> and <@U0260V1BX>, I’d move both to post launch
i’m much more concerned with getting them a functional site that is mostly on point
vs. any additional changes
great
Thanks!
q: on demo submit forms, do we have the resulting page hooked up properly?
At the moment all forms redirect to <http://trap.it/thank-you|trap.it/thank-you>
which pulls up old site at moment, though it might just be a mid-migration thing
That's just b/c the redirect is set on the Hubspot end of things.
It should show the new site one we launch.
ok
is there a way to test that before we officially launch?
Sure. Let me change the redirect on Hubspot. BRB.
thx
sorry to be pain
<@U0265G76F> do you just want to make sure the thank you page looks ok or are you looking to replicate the exact UX?
just want to ensure that the site is functional
bc you can see the page here: <http://trdev.uncorkedstudios.com/thank-you>
ok
or <http://newpub.trapit.com/thank-you>
cool
I went ahead and changed the redirects for now. Just so we can test the whole flow.
cool. thanks
I'm adding a Trello card to change them back on launch.
looks good
think we should switch right now to whatever will be launch ready. Apologies for dance
just testing
No problem. It's only a minute.
OK, done.
and does the same idea apply to footer links?
that those will update on live site
Those should be working now except for the blog link which will be updated in the next hour.
specifically about and blog
Can we please put a moratorium on uploading any files to the CMS?
I'm going to flip my switches and dont want to loose anything in the interim
fine by me.
OK.
k
all good
how’d that switch flip go?
hank was asking me if we have ETA on a fix for the blog
i’m assuming that those switches are part of the fix
What's wrong with the blog
not sure
I think my flipswitch on assets went just fine.
sorry - my bad - I broke something in switch flip...  not sure its what hank is pointing out, but If anyone else is seeing something odd, just a moment and it will go away
ok
different topic - what happens to blog comments when they’re submitted? Do we have that all wired up properly?
<@U0265G76F> Not sure I understand the blog problem.
think the original blog problem seems to be ok
but different question was about comments on blog
Re: comments, Hubspot has a comment managing section to read, approve/delete comments.

and yet another question for blog: Do we need to do anything specific to ensure the ‘get a free demo’ is same call to action on site: ‘request a demo’? 

Not sure if blog will eventually inherit styles from site
The block is a bit behind. I've a task to push styles and popup later today.
I fixed my oops.
ok cool.
so with everybody here — do we have a ETA when we’re prepared to say: Our pre-launch work here is done? Flip the switch Trapit?
just trying to get a sense of what needs doing, and when later is
to ensure that client has people prepared to support us
You could flip now and I would be fine.   I have some things I am still doing but they dont hurt anything.
ok.
and everything is living on their box now?
all the files are there, yes.   I'm still scrubbing through the database to update urls to point at their box.
ok
I still have a couple of tasks I need to finish
ok cool
Had to recreate a few assets and I'm a bit behind.
all good
not trying to hassle, just keeping everybody on top of communication
hey <@U02618EV1> can you tell me how i need to export the SVG? I don't understand the issue
sketch seems to be moving the vectors around which is why i avoided using it in the first palce
place

You can export them from Illustrator first, and then open the SVG in Sketch and export it to SVG again from there. Not sure why the ones exported from AI don't work but this process seems to fix all the weirdness in Android.
ok... i am going to have to re-draw this one for you... will get it to you soon
sorry
sketch is messing up the vector placement
Sorry about that. Not sure if it has snap to grid setting that can be turned off.
its no problem.

 - cowgp

 - gastonfig

 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/4a775a97f6f121e2db9e91f6e8b0384bd79d3479|4a775a97f6f1>: Moved blocks to their own Sass module.
 - gastonfig

 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/15458f9eff1b89cc1d71c2f5e084dea28d73030d|15458f9eff1b>: Fixed svg icons.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/d9e39438669633886342a968be64af7112a58962|d9e394386696>: Added favicon.
 - gastonfig
[trapit-site-2014/] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/7355efe2e72a553f9c4d7d9ec88502fdc6fe5ead|7355efe2e72a>: Merge branch 'master' of <http://bitbucket.org:uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014|bitbucket.org:uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014>
 - gastonfig
From Carlo:

[5/12/14, 4:42:43 PM] Carlo Licciardi: about the broken blog link
[5/12/14, 4:43:05 PM] Carlo Licciardi: we need to wire in the link "<http://blog.trap.it/blog>"
[5/12/14, 4:43:29 PM] Carlo Licciardi: right now it's just a "/blog" and it's not going to work once we flip the switch
think that is mostly for <@U02618EV1>
Yes. Should be done soon.
<@U0265G76F> who were the three people who needed accounts? Carlo, Kelly, and I forget the third
<@U0289USNA> is the moratorium on the CMS still active
carlo, kelly and hank
thanks!
I will do it.
if you are going to do anything on the CMS please now do it on the "real" one.
<http://trcms.trapit.com>
shit's getting real
thanks

[trapit-site-2014/master] <https://bitbucket.org/uncorkedstudios/trapit-site-2014/commits/79fda027a803fc0f0e559aa2d6376bcd243dc397|79fda027a803>: Wired up the blog.
 - gastonfig
<@U0265G76F>: trapit users on the CMS are now setup.
<http://trcms.trapit.com>
carlo, kelly, and hank can all login with their first name as their user and a password of "tr4p!t"
ok, so i updated some of the PDFs in the new CMS
where can i go to see if they download properly?
as i dont see them on the dev site...
<http://newpub.trapit.com>
<@U0260V1BX> I'm not having any luck with improving the animations.
in what way?
can you not stagger the "its" and the body copy separately?
or have them all move from left-to-right?
Staggering is the problem.
Realized that in order to stagger the animations we need a different library/method.
ok... so minus the staggering, can we get the desired movement? very subtle sweep in from left-to-right?
at this point guys, I think we need to table this
ah ok
yeah lets do what needs to get done for launch and refine the animations later
i’m still not certain we have a stable site on their servers
ok
client is super happy with animations as is, though i agree we can improve at a later time
<@U02618EV1> - do you know if that blog fix has landed on production?
I just pushed it
it should work now
cool
thanks
blog works on their side!
ok - one more minor thing we need to check on
let me know if either of you want food
not sure how long you’re planning on staying
i can be here however long is helpful
i was just going to ask if there's anything else i need to do
i think we're past the point of visual QA
agreed
i think we should be good for the timebeing
ok
<@U02618EV1> is there anything else you need from me?
I think we're good. Thank you <@U0260V1BX>.
sure thing
thanks!!
I'm finishing the blog's header and the I'll go home.
Will tackle more bugs once I get there.
thank you both for your incredible, and incredibly hard work
sorry this has been a slog
Is it possible that Trapit created a new comments form for their blog? There seems to be a completely new form in there and the styles don't apply anymore.
It's definitely possible they didn't do this and it's just Hubspot being difficult but I thought I would ask just in case.
Doubt they'd change anything
Will ask in am
Thanks. Will look into it too.
